service.title: Content Security Policy Level 3
service.documentation: This document defines a mechanism by which web developers can control the resources which a particular page can fetch or execute, as well as a number of security-relevant policy decisions.

http-header.documentation: The Content-Security-Policy HTTP response header field is the preferred mechanism for delivering a policy from a server to a client.
The Content-Security-Policy-Report-Only HTTP response header field allows web developers to experiment with policies by monitoring (but not enforcing) their effects.
